comments.author: Amanda Selders

comments.text:
Removing half of someone's brain will fuck them up if it is done after 
brain development has occurred. 
Only if you remove half the brain of a baby, whose brain is still making 
many connections and able to compensate for the loss will leave them to 
lead a "normal" life. Doing that to an adult would cause paralysis, memory 
loss, loss of many skills, and so on. =/ ﻿
comments.author: Astrid

comments.text:
+MonkeysLovePotato search on youtube "girl living with half a brain". She 
had it removed due to many fits.
comments.author: Ellie Pringle

comments.text:
Here's a wikipedia article talking about it:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hemispherectomy

...and if you don't like wikipedia, you are more than free to go read every 
single legitimate article they sourced in the end of the article.
comments.author: Astrid

comments.text:
Adults who have a hemispherectomy will have paralysis and memory loss. 
That's what happens when someone's brain is already wired. I am not denying 
neuroplasticity and I am not denying that someone can re-learn skills. 

The fact is that if you do a hemispherectomy of someone in their late teens 
or older, the person will probably have to re-learn many many many skills. 
People will be able to visibly notice that the person has some 
difficulties. Never did I say it lowers IQ or makes someone stupid. It 
literally cuts out parts of the brain where relevant skills and information 
was stored, which is not the same as lowering someone's IQ, you dingus. 

If you do it to a baby whose brain is still bursting with growth and new 
neural pathways, by the time that baby is a child no one will be able to 
tell that they have had anything wrong at all. 

Sorry bro. Having half of your brain removed after childhood fucks you up 
and takes a long time and lots of physical and cognitive therapy to recover 
from.
comments.author: Astrid

comments.text:
+Astrid No it wont "fuck them up". That is not only incredibly offensive to 
say but also very ignorant as it is just false.

Adult patients that undergo an HP, will also have their brain reconnecting 
the wiring.
Yes, younger patients will have a greater result at reconnecting.
The most prominent "result" from the operation is the hemiplegia. Total or 
less control of areas that the brain controls (depends on what side of the 
brain that is removed)
This occurs in young patients aswell.
For an example, removing the left hemisphere, will make the patient having 
trouble with their speech. It all varies from patient to patient how severe 
it is.

The IQ has been shown to stay the same from preoperative tests to 
Postoperative(Usually tested around 30-38 months after operation).

comments.text:
No one can live with half of their brain removed. The part of the brain 
that makes you heart automatically pump and to automatically breath is in 
the middle of the brain, if it gets touched you die pretty much instantly. 
They also said "normal life". Your left brain controls the right part of 
your body, and the Right left. So if you took one part, half of your body 
was unmovable and you would lose you creativeness, logically, mathematical, 
psychological mind... You would just be out of your fucking mind! And 
what's the point of living without half of you brain?﻿

comments.author: Hulk Remade

comments.text:
Whoa, dude. Calm down. Of course you cant remove the frontal lobe. BUT you 
can remove HALF of the brain. My nephew, just over a year ago had the 
entire right half of his brain removed, excluding the frontal lobe. 
Perfectly capable of living a normal life- with the exception of having no 
peripheral vision and limited mobility in one of his hands. Can now walk, 
talk, learning to read, basic mathematics, and is very creative.  So, 
again, you are wrong.
comments.author: Chelsey Grider

comments.text:
+Sander Gjertsen Østvold don't take the video for granted - they probably 
meant half of the brain's mass, but different parts of it, not necessarily 
just the left or right part, but certain parts from different areas that a 
human could survive without.

Proved it wrong. I think the reason for your thinking this is that our 
tongues, when resting naturally, are in our mouths. This means that in 
order to stick your tongue out, you have to use the muscles in your tongue. 
Therefore, your tongue can't stop moving. BUT, if you close your lips over 
your tongue and relax your tongue, your tongue stops moving and can't go 
back into your mouth because your closed lips are stopping your tongue from 
doing so. Try it.

comments.text:
There are some strange things I learnt about the human body from my korean 
friends. Sort of old school remedies similar to chinese acupuncture.

1) Every organ in your body is somehow connected to the muscles or nerve 
endings on the sole of your foot. By applying pressure to certain areas and 
gauging the ammount of discomfort you feel you can tell how healthy your 
liver, kidneys, heart, stomach etc are. Wierd but true.

2) When feeling naucious (sick?) koreans prick the cuticle of thier left 
thumb nail with a pin and squeeze some blood out. The blood that comes out 
is almost black at first. They keep squeezing until all the dark blood is 
gone and red blood comes out. One of two things will happen then. Either 
you will no longer feel sick in the stomache or you will vomit, and then 
feel 100% better. I have had this done to me many times. It works!

3) There is a pressure point between your thumb and forefinger that when 
massaged, instantly relieves headaches. I have done this when suffering 
migranes and the migrane becomes nothing more than a small headache, 
eventually, nothing!

4) Similar to the foot thing, facial muscles effect how the rest of our 
body "feels". I have had some intence facial massages from my ex gf when I 
complained about feeling ill and you can't believe how great you feel 
afterwards. Especially when massaged around the synuses, temple and base of 
the skull. I often do this to myself now when feeling run down or tired.

5) This one is not so strange but people forget it. Massaging your muscles 
regularly helps to release deadly toxins that are stored there from fatigue 
or stress. The toxins are released into the blood stream, which may sound 
bad, but actually allows your liver and kidneys process and eliminate those 
toxins. It also releases endorphins stored up in your muscles which gives 
you a kind of euphoric high. Get regular massages people!

It just goes to show, homeopathic and alternative treatment is not all new 
age nonsense like most westerners believe. Think I might try acupuncture 
for my sore back some time in the future ;)

comments.text:
To popular belief, people with leprosy tend to have body parts just fall 
off. But what most people don't know is that leprosy causes nerves around 
the body that feel pain to start degenerating and eventually become numb. 
Over time since that area cannot feel pain, so the body doesn't know that 
it's been damaged in any way. Over time, with all the damage done to you, 
your body parts become so damaged that they could just fall off. But it 
takes a bit of force to have it detach from your body. This is why you see 
people infected with leprosy have missing fingers, toes, and sometimes even 
lose eyes. Btw, you can get leprosy from armadillos, so watch out.﻿
